features.notes:
Bilateral upper limb thrombus involving jugular veins bilaterally, brachiocephalic veins and SVC.
This thrombus occurred in the context of the invasive aspergillosis diagnosis.
Treated with enoxaparin with complete resolution. Treatment ceased.
features.label: Venous thrombosis

features.notes:
Patient incidentally found to have chronic HBV infection.
cAB+, eAb+, sAg+, HBV DNA 820 IU/mL.
Likely vertical transmission.
features.label: Viral hepatitis

features.notes:
Multiple lung mycetomas (across all lobes).
Left brain lesion (biopsy proven aspergillosis).

Both lung and brain: aspergillus flavus complex
features.label: Invasive pulmonary aspergillosis

features.notes: Needed right middle lobe lobectomy for tuberculosis at age 12. Medical records in India, was treated with prolonged course of multiple antibiotics. TB diagnosis is considered not confirmed, as we have not seen reports of the cultures, and the patient's TB gamma interferon test was negative.
features.label: Pulmonary tuberculosis

features.notes: IgE >5000 with not clear history of allergy
features.label: Abnormal IgE level
